aim.aim_description: To provide customers with facilities that may assist them in sticking to their personal budgets for gambling with the operator. Customers must be also be given the option to set financial limits at an account level

requirements.title: Financial Limit Setting Facilities
requirements.full_text: The gambling system must provide easily accessible facilities that make it possible for customers to impose their own financial limits. Customers must be given the opportunity to set a limit as part of the registration process (or at the point at which the customer makes the first deposit or payment).

implementation_guidance.full_text: For telephone gambling (except lotteries), customers should be asked if they would like to set a deposit or spend limit when they register. Customers should be able to request a limit at any point after registration. The limit should be implemented as soon as practicable after the customer's request. The customer should be informed when the limit will come into force. For other access media (including internet, interactive TV and mobile), customers should be offered the opportunity to select a deposit/spend limit from a list which may contain a 'no limit' option or to enter a limit of their choice as part of the registration or first deposit process. The 'no limit' option should not be the default option. Limits could be in the form of: deposit limits: where the amount a customer deposits into their account is limited over a particular duration; spend limits: where the amount a customer spends on gambling (or specific gambling products) is restricted for a given period – this type of limit may be appropriate where the customer does not hold a deposit account with the operator; loss limits: where the amount lost (that is, winnings subtracted from the amount spent) is restricted (for instance when a customer makes a £10 bet and wins £8, the loss is £2). The period/duration of the limits on offer should include: 24 hours and; 7 days and; one month. In addition: limits may be implemented per customer, per account, or other means; limits could also be implemented across all products or channels or for individual products or channels. Where limits are also set across separate products it should be clear to customers using the facility that a limit will need to be set for each individuals product. For example, where a limit has been set for a specific game a customer should not be misled into assuming that the limit automatically applies to other products; financial limit facilities should be provided via a link on the homepage; facilities should be available on deposit pages/screens or via a link on these pages or screens; where a customer sets simultaneous time frames, for example a daily deposit limit and a weekly limit, the lowest limit should always apply. Therefore if a daily deposit limit of £10 and a weekly limit of £100 are both set then the maximum the system should allow to be deposited is £10 per day and £70 per week.
key_points: Must provide easily accessible facilities for customers to set financial limits
Customers must be given opportunity to set limit during registration or first deposit
Telephone gambling: ask if customer wants to set deposit/spend limit at registration
Other media: offer selection from list or enter own limit (no limit option must not be default)
Limit types: deposit limits, spend limits, loss limits
Required time periods: 24 hours, 7 days, one month
Can be per customer, per account, across all products, or per product/channel
Financial limit facilities should be on homepage link
Should be available on deposit pages/screens or via link
When multiple timeframes set, lowest limit always applies

requirements.title: Limit Increases and Cooling-Off Period
requirements.full_text: All reasonable steps must be taken to ensure that customer-led limits are only increased at the customer's request, only after a cooling-off period of 24 hours has elapsed and only once the customer has taken positive action at the end of the cooling off period to confirm their request.

implementation_guidance.full_text: Where possible (for instance, unless systems/technical failures prevent it) limit reductions are to be implemented within 24 hours of the request being received. In addition, at the point at which the customer requests a decrease in their limit, they should be informed when the limit reduction will take effect.
key_points: Limit increases: only at customer's request
Limit increases: only after 24 hour cooling-off period
Limit increases: only once customer takes positive action to confirm at end of cooling-off period
Limit reductions: implement within 24 hours where possible
Limit reductions: inform customer when reduction will take effect

compliance_notes.testing_requirements: Must demonstrate easily accessible limit setting, proper cooling-off periods for increases, and rapid implementation of decreases

compliant_implementations: Registration process includes mandatory prompt to set deposit limit
Customer requests £500 weekly limit increase: 24 hour cooling-off period, then requires positive confirmation
Customer requests £200 weekly limit decrease: implemented within hours, customer notified of exact timing
non_compliant_scenarios: 'No limit' set as default option - NOT ALLOWED
Limit increase processed immediately without cooling-off - NOT ALLOWED
Limit reduction delayed beyond 24 hours without system failure - NOT COMPLIANT
Financial limits hidden in obscure menu - NOT COMPLIANT
